page.title: 07Social Concerns
page.content: The main concern for Kingsthorpe at the moment is to deal with the problem of the high numbers of young and old people. We are concerned with helping the old to get out of their houses if they are on their own. There are many places which specialise in caring for them for example, Help the Aged, Obelisk House. There are also warden assisted accomadation areas which have a number of flats all connected to the wardens own flat by a special intercom system. There are also many play groups which deal with young children, for example ST Davids, ST Marks Hall and two play groups at Kingsthorpe Upper School. These are run by parents and specially trained nursery nurses for children between the ages of two and four years old.
